snippet: The United States and China sparred Wednesday over the violence in Syria and growing tensions over territorial disputes in the South China Sea.
abstract: United States and China clash openly over two of the most contentious issues riling their relationship, violence in Syria and growing tensions over territorial disputes in South China Sea; Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton fails to narrow gaps over international crises and the Chinese leadership shows no signs of buckling after months of efforts by Clinton and her senior aides to persuade country to be more flexible on maritime disputes in the South China Sea.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and JANE PERLEZ

lead_paragraph: The United States and China sparred Wednesday over the violence in Syria and growing tensions over territorial disputes in the South China Sea.

headline.seo: No Movement on Key Disputes as Clinton Meets With Chinese Leaders
headline.main: No Movement on Major Disputes as Clinton Meets With Chinese Leaders
headline.print_headline: No Movement on Major Disputes as Clinton Meets With Chinese Leaders
